reasoning: Osteoporotic fractures (hip, vertebral, wrist) global incidence ~145 per 100k person-years based on epidemiological studies from 2000s. Hip fractures alone ~9 per 100k; aggregate includes vertebral (~50 per 100k) and wrist fractures.
source: Johnell O, Kanis JA. (2006). An estimate of the worldwide prevalence and disability associated with osteoporotic fractures. Osteoporos Int. 17(12):1726-33
